Comments_List: So much French!
I saw a great improvement in my speaking and listening from taking this course.
I feel like I am now able to carry out a conversation in French for a lot longer and with better vocabulary than I was before taking this course.
I feel that my french skills and ability to speak the language have vastly improved.
I obtained a better understanding of the French language in terms of grammar, syntax, and vocabulary.
I learned to speak some more french
Language skills, for one, and an appreciation for learning the language itself regardless of grades. The work ethic the hours of homework forced me to develop was also invaluable.

This course solidified many aspects of the french language that a high school education wasn't able to do. The relevance of the lessons and enthusiasm of the professor made the class fun and insightful.

Given how high school French classes often emphasis grammar over speaking and listening, I feel that one of the strengths of French at Yale is that it does the opposite. Grammar rules are largely learned through homework and are clarified in class. That being said, it does require more work to make sure you're up to par on all of the grammar rules before taking tests.

We spend a lot of time talking and conversing with our partners, but I feel that it would be a lot better if we conversed with a teacher or another more experienced person because I really do not feel that I improved much talking with my partners.
The class was wonderful in giving me a more firm grasp of the french culture and language but I felt that the workload was somewhat excessive.

The high level of engagement required in the classroom setting was a strength. Engaging in conversations in French helped me make use of the grammar rules we just learned while also giving me the confidence to speak French more frequently. However, although the French in Action videos were useful, workbook assignments were often overwhelming.

Weaknesses
Homework doesnt help for the tests and takes too much time. I would rather just study the textbook than be graded on useless homework.
